title: What will happen if you mix technology and magic? - Quora

response.answer_text: The question assumes that magic is real. There is, however, no evidence that it is. So, let’s approach the question somewhat mathematically. Technology + Magic = ? Since magic does not exist, or at least the probability that it does is negligibly low, we can set “Magic” in our equation to zero. Technology + Magic = Technology + 0 = Technology So, what do you get if you mix technology and magic? The answer must be: technology.

well everything happens! This is what true old world alchemy was! This is why the great work is called so. And I can hear all the purist call out - blasphemy! I don’t care about that opinion, let be frank about that. If you carefully study the old texts any technologically inclined mind can see exactly how to get from point a-b with many of the instructions. That aside I have personally done it! The mixing of technology and magick is not only viable but has been a working real life model in many civilizations for thousands of years.

If you mean stage magic, a lot of people are doing it now and it looks nice. If you mean paranormal magic, there isn’t any. So all you have is tech. If you are looking at making a magic-tech scifi-fantasy world there is a wealth of existing fiction that explores this.

There’s lots of cool fantasy settings that do this. Most of the time, they are separated somehow - can’t be combined, or one hampers the other. You should totally play the Shadowrun games - in those, the more cybernetics and tech you install in yourself, the less ‘Essence’/’Soul’ you have - making you less able to use magic. One could argue that real-life technology is getting closer to magic all the time.

I have heard of people who do rituals over skype and other video programs on the internet. They report that it works. Some people have cyber covens. I haven’t heard about those except for the above comment. I am a little old fashioned and like everybody in person in this way I can feel the magick and can direct it to it’s purpose. Blessings, Moonwater
